publication.abstract: Tag sequencing using high-throughput sequencing technologies are now regularly employed to identify specific sequence features, such as transcription factor binding sites (ChIP-seq) or regions of open chromatin (DNase-seq). To intuitively summarize and display individual sequence data as an accurate and interpretable signal, we developed F-Seq, a software package that generates a continuous tag sequence density estimation allowing identification of biologically meaningful sites whose output can be displayed directly in the UCSC Genome Browser. Â© 2008 The Author(s).
publication.title: F-Seq: A feature density estimator for high-throughput sequence tags

summary.description: F-seq is a software package that generates a continuous tag sequence density estimation based on tag sequencing to identify specific sequence features such as transcription factor binding sites (ChI-seq) or regions of open chromatin (DNase-seq).
summary.name: F-seq
